title: Byrne Power: L'Abri Lecture - Discovering Puppets in the 21st Century (Puppetry As Antidote Art)
description:
This is an updated and revised version of a lecture on the possibilities of puppetry in the 21st Century. It follows my own discovery of puppetry and my trips to Europe to understand the art. This lecture was popular on my other channel, The Anadromous Life. 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLizS14Kip2qy-_b5AJk18g
This version includes the Q & A and a 2019 update on my involvement with puppetry and the state of the Gravity From Above documentary. This is a chance for the folks visiting this channel to understand - Why Puppetry? 

This lecture with slides was originally given at the L'Abri Fellowship in Huémoz, Switzerland, November 7th 2012. The presentation is both a general look at European puppet history and a personal journey into European puppet theatres. 

Featured in this discussion are Jan Švankmajer, The Brothers Quay, Ladislas Starevitch, Jiří Trnka, Richard Teschner, François Lazaro, the Salzburg Marionette Theater, Aurelia Ivan, Julia Kovacs, Buchty a loutky (Cakes and Puppets), DRAK, Teatr Groteska, the Figuren Zirkel, Henryk Jurkowski, Guignol, Punch, Kašpárek, ESNAM (l'École Nationale Supérieure des Arts de la Marionnette), Die Schaubude, Polish puppetry, French puppetry, Austrian puppetry and Czech puppetry. As well as a discussion of my own puppetry in Haines Alaska. 

For more information on the Gravity From Above documentary film project or about European puppets in general please go to:
http://gravityfromabove.wordpress.com

Please contribute to my work through PayPal:
https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=G9LDYMSPZ5RGG

#puppetry #JanSvankmajer #ByrnePower #puppethistory
